summary: Looking for stupid d&d items to spruce up your game? Here you go! The Necklace of Fire Alarm: this object is a gorgeous,...
body:
Looking for stupid d&d items to spruce up your game? Here you go!

The Necklace of Fire Alarm: this object is a gorgeous, elegantly-cut ruby on a golden chain. Usually, it will lie still around the neck in a state of dormant calm. However, upon hearing any sudden, loud noises or flashes of light, the necklace will immediately become alarmed and and burst into flame. The fire lasts one minute, and is undeniably, unforgettably, scorching. Wearer beware.

The Snow Coat: a thick woolen coat that, for some reason, is always full of snow. Very cold. Very wet.

The Magnet of Missing Things: point this magical magnet in any direction, and concentrate on something you’ve lost. If it is smaller than a five-inch cube and is within a 20-ft radius, it will fly out from wherever it was hiding and attach itself to the magnet. But in return, another one of your belongings immediately goes missing, appearing in a random, hidden location within 20 feet of you.

The Band of Animal Handling: this band is a small wreath of oak leaves. It can be used once per day to instantly summon a random animal with a challenge rating of 0 into your hands. Does not help you deal with the resulting animal.

The Butterfly of Tempestuous Effect: a silver butterfly hairpin, with tiny sapphire eyes. Once per day, this pin can be used to cast the Gust cantrip. Upon the 1,000th utilization of this pin, instead of Gust, it will cast the 9th Level conjuration spell “Storm of Vengeance,” centered on itself, lasting a full 10 rounds. When the churning clouds subside, the pin resets. Try not to lose count.

And two submissions that made me laugh:

The Ring of Detecting Magic-Detecting: this ring glows faintly blue if anyone casts a Detect Magic within a 1 mile radius. Bad if two of these rings ever get too close to one another. (via @fluffy-papaya)

The Bagpipes of Invisibility: a set of scarlet bagpipes enchanted to make their user invisible. Upon playing this instrument, you instantly vanish from view. However, the invisibility wears off when the music stops—so take a deep breath, play strong, and pray your opponents are deaf. (via @madsadcatfish)

• • •

(more lists here! and if you enjoyed these, consider a ☕ ☕?)

tags: hello i'm having a lot of feelings so i wrote them
summary: Later, after they’ve saved their world a few times and moved on to smaller jobs, easier money, less danger, Yasha asks Caleb to...
body:
Later, after they’ve saved their world a few times and moved on to smaller jobs, easier money, less danger, Yasha asks Caleb to take first watch with her.

It’s quiet, at first. They understand each other better, these days. They know when silence is necessary, they share hugs and gold with the same ease, it’s easier to find the right words to say. But there are still some things that are hard to talk about, some things that they try to forget.

Two hours pass in comfortable silence before Yasha speaks.

“He loved you, you know,” she says, staring into the fire.

Caleb doesn’t need to ask who she’s talking about, so he doesn’t say a word.

She turns her eyes towards him and begins to speak in Celestial. “You don’t have to say anything, but I want to make sure you know.”

“I know,” Caleb responds, somehow finding it easier to speak in this language that is known only by the two of them.

“I am not sure if he would have told you, eventually. For all his confidence, words were difficult for him.” Yahsa pauses, and then adds, “You had that in common.”

Caleb sighs, his eyes dropping to the ground for a moment. “I wish,” he starts, and then freezes. 

Yasha stays silent, giving him space to finish or to move on, whichever he chooses.

“I wish we had more time,” he finally says, eyes not moving from the ground. “I was not ready to love in the way that he could love, not then.”

“Would you be now?”

“Maybe. I have… I have grown a lot in our time together. I have learned to live with myself, with the things that I have done, with the person I have been.”

“And you are someone new now,” Yasha says, studying Caleb’s profile, the smile lines that were not there only a few years ago.

“I am,” he agrees, and then turns his head to face her. “Do you think he would have waited? Do you think he would… would feel the same way about this version of me?”

Yasha hesitates only a moment before saying simply, “Yes.”

Caleb’s mouth curls into the hint of a smile, and then turns his eyes back to the fire.

They spend the rest of their watch in silence.

tags: just listened to this and felt it's a good Beau song
summary:
Florence + The Machine - Lover To Lover 
And I've been taking chances I've been setting myself up for the fall And I've been...
caption:
Florence + The Machine - Lover To Lover

And I’ve been taking chances
I’ve been setting myself up for the fall
And I’ve been keeping secrets
From my heart and from my soul

Going from row to row
Back to back
Lover to lover
Black to red

But I believe, I believe
There’s no salvation for me now
No space among the clouds
And I’ve feel that I’m heading down
But that’s alright

summary: My little ideal scenarios for what I want to happen in the next episodes (these are my own headcannons and may never happen but...
body:
My little ideal scenarios for what I want to happen in the next episodes (these are my own headcannons and may never happen but oh well)

1) The M9 go full on resurrection campaign and have to do errands and favors to get a cleric. Which means that not only would Caduceus stick around for a while but Molly could potentially come back alive.

2) They do get a resurrection (barring potential plotty complications aside) but Molly decides to hang back to recuperate with Yasha because he’ll be severely weakened… and I can actually see it in his character to want to hang back for a bit because being dead and reviving might hit too close to his fears from the first time he clawed out of the grave.

3) They find the grave EMPTY. And everybody is like WTFFFFFFFF

body:

Me, who doesn’t cope with things but just sidesteps away and run away from my feelings instead of acknowledging that I care about people: Neat.

summary:
if (when) Travis McElroy ends up guesting on CR, I’m sort of torn on how I’d feel if he plays Magnus again
On one hand, Magnus...
body:
if (when) Travis McElroy ends up guesting on CR, I’m sort of torn on how I’d feel if he plays Magnus again


On one hand, Magnus is part of his own wonderful story and I think it’d be very strange to see him in another property in a serious manner. Plus I’m always excited to see what characters guests come up with and see how they can expand the world with them. It’d be pretty rad to see Travis McElroy contribute to CR with a new character.


On the other hand, I desperately want to see Magnus and Fjord just absolutely munch down on a bunch of magical items like they’re splitting a basket of fries.

summary: Critical Role Series 8/8 <Previous|END] Name: The Tome Of The Storyteller Appearance: An ancient tome bound in cracked and...
body:
Critical Role Series 8/8

<Previous|END]

Name: The Tome Of The Storyteller

Appearance: An ancient tome bound in cracked and weathered dragon leather, once a bright crimson but turned a deep blood red with time, It measures 12in by 8in by 3.5in thick, and in the centre of the front cover is a faint emblem in weathered gold leaf that depicts a strange six-sided shape filled with smaller triangles and a sword vertically through the middle. The pages within are of a semi-thick parchment, yellowed with age and covered in beautifully written and illuminated text that none can read.

Effects:

Character Growth: As the party grows in strength of mind, body and soul, gradually they will begin to understand parts of the text within. These passages will only appear if the book deems that the party have grown enough as characters and will begin to teach them of dungeons that contain loot, or people who need saving, or knowledge long since lost. And at higher levels, it will begin to teach any caster classes powerful spells.

The Path Ahead: At each dawn, there is a two in six chance that, if the book is opened, it will have readable text. If the text does appear, it will lay out 1d6 possibilities for how that day could possibly go, while not giving them the exact path to each outcome.

Rarity: Legendary

Value: Incalculable
